content.text:
This website has 2 main reasons to be alive. It is 1) an exercise in HTML, CSS and JS, and 2) a place where I collect various projects and things I want to save in one spot. I quite like the style of the website, so I might use it as some kind of resume website later.  
  
The site is hosted on GitHub pages. Because GHP doesn't allow server-side logic, I've had to make a slightly dubious workaround to avoid having to write lots of copies of the same HTML code. There's only one HTML document, and the page data is instead stored in JSON files. These files are then requested and handled client-side, rather than constructing everything on the server. Slightly yucky, and it requires a few unnecessary requests, but I couldn't come up with a better solution. I'm currently in the process of moving to a non-static hosting platform.  
  
It's still kind of empty, but I'll put stuff here when I feel like it would fit.

I'm a swedish student born 2006, living and studying in Uppsala at the moment. I like programming and mathematics, and am currently (as of autumn 2025) also trying to learn more about electronics and breadboard circuits.  
  
To my memory, I have programmed since when I was around 8 years old, mostly just for fun. But occasionally I've been able to find applications for my programs.

Familiar programming languages:  
\- C#  
\- HTML/CSS/JS  
\- Python  
\- Processing/Java  
(For more information, see [my programming projects](?page=programming/programming_projects))
